alert.note: Alert for Big Horn; Rosebud (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 11:28PM MDT until June 09 at 1:30AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM MDT FRIDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN BIG HORN AND SOUTH CENTRAL ROSEBUD COUNTIES... At 1128 PM MDT, Doppler radar estimates between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen in the warned area, and additional light to moderate rain continues to fall. Flash flooding is likely ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, normally dry coulees, highways, rural roads and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. This includes the following streams and drainages... Hardrobe Creek, Canyon Creek, Bull Creek, Jack Creek, Slocum Creek, Trail Creek, Wild Hog Creek, Post Creek, Prairie Dog Creek, Zook Creek, Paddy Creek, Leaf Rock Creek, Clarks Fork Canyon Creek, Fourmile Creek, Cook Creek, Taintor Fork Canyon Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
